pr_title: Fix bug in data access token download.

timeline.message:
Fix bug in data access token download.

Argument for 'allowRemovalOfExistingTokens' has been disconnected or
removed in some way.

When a user attempts to download a token from the
login dropdown menu, if the option to revoke existing tokens was
enabled then the user would be presented with an error if they had an
existing token instead of being issued a brand new one.

We have decided to simply remove this functionality and always issue a
new token on request.

Signed-off-by: Angelica Ochoa <15623749+ao508@users.noreply.github.com>

timeline.bodyText: Now that the oldest token will automatically be deleted to make room for a new token to be issued, this test case no longer will generate the expected MaxNumberTokensExceededException. The next test has the test for the expected behavior (that the oldest token (OLDEST_TOKEN_UUID) gets deleted from the database. From now on, that will always happen when the user is at their quota limit, so this test can be dropped.
timeline.author: sheridancbio

timeline.bodyText: same as prior comment. This test is no longer needed because MaxNumberTokensExceededException can no longer be generated. The user will always successfully receive a token .. even if it means that a previously issued and still valid token needs to be deleted to accomplish it.
timeline.author: sheridancbio

timeline.bodyText: This function no longer serves any purpose. I suggest we drop this function and replace calls to it with a call to tokenService.createDataAccessToken(userName) instead.
